sub_title: Senior Project Manager, Hydrogeologist and Groundwater Well Expert
summary:
Hydrology has been one of my passions since childhood. As consultant and project leader I have over 15 years of experience in the Netherlands and abroad in the field of hydrogeology and well management. 

My main field of expertise is clogging and integrity of wells for drinking water, irrigation, geothermal energy storage, etc. Previous work experience and secondments with consultancy firms, research institutes, water utilities, water boards and government agencies help me to gain an understanding of what is necessary to bring projects to a successful end. The past years, I focus on delivering large multi-client studies. Jointly coming up with solutions and testing them in practice gives me energy. 

Country experience:
Cambodia, Ethiopia, Laos, Mozambique, Netherlands, South Africa, Swaziland, Thailand, USA, Viet Nam.
Youth exchange programme with theatre action group in India.

Favorite projects:
- Clogging of sub-irrigation schemes (2019-present)
- Microbial profiling of short circuit flow in drinking water wells (2015- present)
- Field Pilot: Horizontal Drilled Wells (2013-present)
- Field Pilot: Expanded diameter Gravel Well, EDGW (2015-present)
- Clogging of dewatering system at excavate building site with Silicagel (2015-2017)
- Permeation of Polyethylene drinking water pipelines with organic Micro Pollutants (2013-present)
- Potentials for Fresh water supply and flood prevention using ASR (2013-2014)
- Impacts of ground water management on conservation of archeology (2012). 
- Scenario study on Water Management strategies and Climate Change on Subsidence in Peat Soils, Utrecht (2011-2010)
- Field trial water quality impacts of composite drainage, Zeeland (2009 - 2012).
- Integrated Fire- and Water management Strategy for Tram Chim Wetland, Viet Nam (2003 -2006)
- Improving irrigation performance in Africa (2002-2004)
- Watersecurity in Transboundary Riverbasin Management between South Africa and Mozambique (2001) - bicycle tour to interview stakeholders

Development of hydrogeological tools:
- GRETA: python package to calculate the fate of Organic Micropollutant and pathogens in the subsoil (ongoing)
- HGC: python package for analysis of ground water quality samples, based on work of Stuijfzand, 2017. (ongoing)
- PHOENIX 1.0: An ArcGis based Regional Soil Subsidence Model for Peat Soils (2012)
- DG Dialog Groundwater : A groundwater module for an Assetmanamagent package of Municipalities (2011)
